meanings.definition: The leaves at the beginning and end of a book, typically blank.
meanings.sent1: The endleaves of the book were left blank for notes.
meanings.sent2: I found a doodle on the endleaves of my notebook.
meanings.sent3: The endleaves were so empty, they looked like they were waiting for a story.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a book with endleaves ready to be filled with memories.
meanings.sent5: The endleaves fluttered in the wind, whispering secrets of the story within.

meanings.definition: To insert endleaves into a book.
meanings.sent1: She carefully endleaves the new pages into the book.
meanings.sent2: The librarian endleaves the protective sheets into each novel.
meanings.sent3: He endleaves the papers as if planting seeds in a book garden.
meanings.sent4: The author endleaves her thoughts into the manuscript, completing the story.
meanings.sent5: With each page turned, she endleaves a piece of herself in the book.
